content.description: Awesome line! Sit start under the overhang using the lowest jugs as starting holds. For  starting feet Use the pedestal and a high right foot to pull on. Climb straight over the bulge and up the face, using the crack all the way to the top. Can also use a high sloper to the left for the top out rather than the top part of the crack.-There is also a V6 version that starts with double under clings. All rock base footholds are off. Use feet in the roof only.
content.protection: minimum 2 pads and a spotter recommended.
content.location: When walking from Lake'o Dallas,  Turn right taking Echo trail (as if your heading to Indian head). At the small swamp/pond to your left, you will see a boulder with a low overhang and a unique crack leading up the face. That is swamp thing. -note: you should still be able to see the lake when your near swamp thing. If you can not see it when looking back at the trail then you went too far into the woods, back track and the boulder will be on your right (when you walking out).

content.description: Start with right hand on a crimp on the right arete, left on an undercling on the lip of the overhang. Compress your way up the pillar.Very cool, highly featured rock on this one that is similar to that found at Tiny Bubbles
Sit start on the left side of the boulder with good feet and work your way up on comfy crimps and little jugs to a fun top out.
content.location: Located about 100 yards up hill from Swamp Thing. From the north side of Lake O‘ the Dalles, take the Echo Canyon Trail until you see a small pond on your left and Swamp Thing. Head towards Swamp Thing and continue up the hill.Since this is actually closer to the River Bluff Trail you can also take that until you see a trail marker that is being consumed by a tree. Head right and downhill. It is trickier to find this way since you won’t be able to see it while approaching.

content.description: Spring/ fall is the best.  hot and buggy in the summer as it is by a swamp.
